required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vestibular Rehabilitation for Strokepatients With Dizziness
clinical_study.official_title: Vestibular Rehabilitation for Strokepatients With Dizziness - a Randomized Controlled Trial.

oversight_info.authority: Sweden: Regional Ethical Review Board in Lund

brief_summary.textblock:
Recently, the investigators has shown that dizziness is common among patients with first time stroke and that it affects self perceived health. There are indications that vestibular rehabilitation can have effect of neurological causes of dizziness and vertigo and it therefore seems important to find out if vestibular rehabilitation can affect dizziness among patients with stroke.
The aim of this study is to find out if vestibular rehabilitation can have any effect on function, balance and self-rated health among patients with first time stroke.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline and three months after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire. The ABC-scale has proven to be able to identify the influence that vestibular dysfunction can have on daily activities.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline and three months after baseline
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire. EQ5D consists of a descriptive system comprising five dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has three levels: no problems, some problems, severe problems. The patient indicates his/her state by marking the most appropriate statement. This result in a 1-digit number and the digits for the five dimensions can be combined in a five-digit number, generating 243 possible combinations of response.The EQ5D also consist of the EQ VAS where the patients' record self-rated health on a vertical, visual analogue scale where the individual points can be used as a quantitative measure with zero as worst rated health and 100 as best rated health

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change between baseline and three months after baseline

arm_group.description: Usual rehabilitation whitout additional vestibular exercises

intervention.description: Usual rehabilitation and four different vestibular rehabilitation exercises, adapted to the individual patient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
• First time stroke with dizziness -
Exclusion Criteria
- Not first time stroke
- No dizziness
